pullRequest.body:
Define the type of finite Galois subextensions and prove basic properties about it.
Co-authored-by: Yuyang Zhao <zhao.yu-yang@foxmail.com> Nailin Guan <3571819596@qq.com> Jujian Zhang <jujian.zhang1998@outlook.com>

Moves:
- Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois -> Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Basic

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #17197

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [62e94dbd0d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16978/commits/62e94dbd0d78b2f7c2e8112db708088b36322672)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Infinite`|1385|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_comp`
`+ AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_comp_apply`
`+ AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_id`
`+ FiniteGaloisIntermediateField`
`+ FiniteGaloisIntermediateField.finGaloisGroup`
`+ adjoin`
`+ adjoin_map`
`+ adjoin_simple_le_iff`
`+ adjoin_simple_map_algEquiv`
`+ adjoin_simple_map_algHom`
`+ adjoin_val`
`+ finGaloisGroupFunctor`
`+ finGaloisGroupMap`
`+ instance (L : FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) : FiniteDimensional k L`
`+ instance (L : FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) : IsGalois k L := L.isGalois`
`+ instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [Algebra.IsSeparable k L‚ÇÅ] :`
`+ instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [Algebra.IsSeparable k L‚ÇÇ] :`
`+ instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [FiniteDimensional k L‚ÇÅ] :`
`+ instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [FiniteDimensional k L‚ÇÇ] :`
`+ instance : Coe (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) (IntermediateField k K)`
`+ instance : CoeSort (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) (Type _)`
`+ instance : Inf (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)`
`+ instance : Lattice (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)`
`+ instance : OrderBot (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)`
`+ instance : Sup (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)`
`+ krullTopology_mem_nhds_one`
`+ le_iff`
`+ map_comp`
`+ map_id`
`+ normalClosure_le_iff_of_normal`
`+ normalClosure_map_eq`
`+ subset_adjoin`
`+ val_injective`
`++ instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [IsGalois k L‚ÇÅ] [IsGalois k L‚ÇÇ] :`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
This PR seems to be mixing a move of `Galois` to `Galois.Basic` with the addition of finite Galois subextensions. Could you please make the moving a separate PR?

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17197~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I'll review more later, I have to run now.

There is indeed no dimension directly involved in the file `InfiniteDimensional.lean`, it is only because this part is usually called infinite Galois theory, any suggestions about the naming of the file `FieldTheory.Galois.InfiniteDimensional` ? Thank you.

> There is indeed no dimension directly involved in the file `InfiniteDimensional.lean`, it is only because this part is usually called infinite Galois theory, any suggestions about the naming of the file `FieldTheory.Galois.InfiniteDimensional` ? Thank you.

What about just `Infinite`? Being already in `FieldTheory.Galois`, it will be unambiguous.

The category part exist because I need to use the limit of profinite group to prove the Galois group is equal to the projective limit of the Galois Group of finite Galois subextensions thus profinite in PR #16993. The fundamental theorem doesn't use them.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by faenuccio.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11408552618/job/31746970491)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11408552618/job/31746970737)
I left some comments before touching upon the main file `InfiniteDimensional.lean` (which should probably have another name, there is no "dimension" involved, no?).
I left some comments about the `Infinite` file

I have added a couple of comments, but I now realise where most of my confusion (that also caused the misunderstanding about the Galois insertion) comes from the question: why do you want to phrase these results in categorical terms? All results in `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Basic` are expressed just using groups/group homomorphisms and never using category theory. Can you provide a good explanation for this change?
I think we're almost done. Please merge master and address my three remarks.
This does not seem to agree with the PR description. Is this intended?
Sorry that I just copy every thing from my original file, I should fix it.

```suggestion
# Galois Group as a profinite group
```

```suggestion
In this file, we prove that in a Galois extension `K/k`, there is a continuous isomorphism between
```
Also this seems to remain a TODO for now, right? So maybe either add a "(TODO)" or add it to the TODO list below.
Sorry that I just copy the docstring from my original file, it would be done soon in #16993, I should just delete it for now

```suggestion
`Gal(K/k)` and the limit of `Gal(L/k)`, where `L` is a finite galois intermediate field ordered by
```

```suggestion

* `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` : The type of a finite Galois intermediate field of `K/k`
```
I don't understand this half sentence.

```suggestion

* `finGalMap` : For `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` s `L‚ÇÅ` and `L‚ÇÇ` with `L‚ÇÇ ‚â§ L‚ÇÅ`
  giving the restriction of `Gal(L‚ÇÅ/k)` to `Gal(L‚ÇÇ/k)`

```

```suggestion
* `finGalFunctor` : Mapping `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` ordered by inverse inclusion to its
  corresponding Galois Group as `FiniteGrp`.
```
I don't think this lemma has to be `private`.
I'll just move it to Krulltopology.lean

```suggestion
theorem AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_comp (F K‚ÇÅ K‚ÇÇ K‚ÇÉ : Type*)
```
Also I think, `F` can be implicit here.

```suggestion
  ext f x
  apply (algebraMap K‚ÇÅ K‚ÇÉ).injective
  rw [IsScalarTower.algebraMap_eq K‚ÇÅ K‚ÇÇ K‚ÇÉ]
  simp [AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom, ‚Üê IsScalarTower.algebraMap_apply]
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem normalClosure_le_iff_of_normal {K‚ÇÅ K‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField F L} [Normal F K‚ÇÇ] :
    normalClosure F K‚ÇÅ L ‚â§ K‚ÇÇ ‚Üî K‚ÇÅ ‚â§ K‚ÇÇ := by
  refine ‚ü®fun h ‚Ü¶ ?_, fun h ‚Ü¶ ?_‚ü©
  ¬∑ rw [normalClosure_le_iff] at h
    simpa only [fieldRange_val] using h K‚ÇÅ.val
  ¬∑ rw [‚Üê normalClosure_of_normal K‚ÇÇ]
    exact normalClosure_mono K‚ÇÅ K‚ÇÇ h
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma normalClosure_map (K : IntermediateField F L) (œÉ : L ‚Üí‚Çê[F] L) :
    normalClosure F (K.map œÉ) L = normalClosure F K L :=
  have (œÉ : L ‚âÉ‚Çê[F] L) : normalClosure F (K.map (œÉ : L ‚Üí‚Çê[F] L)) L = normalClosure F K L := by
    simp_rw [normalClosure_def'', map_map]
    exact (Equiv.mulRight œÉ).iSup_congr fun _ ‚Ü¶ rfl
  this ((Algebra.IsAlgebraic.algEquivEquivAlgHom _ _).symm œÉ)
```
I don't understand the comment `/-- extend from IntermediateField -/`. Is there a reason why you don't use `extends IntermediateField k K`?

```suggestion
/-- The finite Galois intermediate field obtained from the normal closure of adjoining a `s : Set K` to `k`. -/
```
Should this be `@[simp]`?

```suggestion
variable (k) in
lemma subset_adjoin [IsGalois k K] (s : Set K) [Finite s] :
    s ‚äÜ (adjoin k s).val :=
  (IntermediateField.subset_adjoin k s).trans (IntermediateField.le_normalClosure _)
```

I think we should add
```
lemma le_iff (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) :
    L‚ÇÅ ‚â§ L‚ÇÇ ‚Üî L‚ÇÅ.val ‚â§ L‚ÇÇ.val :=
  Iff.rfl
```
to eliminate the `show` line here. Then the proof of this lemma (with the `simp` attribute added above) becomes `by simp [le_iff]`.
This could also be `@[simp]` I think.

```suggestion
/-- The `AlgEquiv` version of `adjoin_simple_map`. -/
```
(similarly below)
To eliminate the `'`, I think `adjoin_simple_map_algEquiv` would be a reasonable name.

```suggestion
/-- The (finite) Galois group `Gal(K / k)` associated to an `L : FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K` `L`. -/
def galoisGroup (L : FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K) : FiniteGrp :=
```
I find `finGal` is not very descriptive.

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma map_id (L : (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)·µí·µñ) :
    (finGalMap (ùüô L)) = ùüô L.unop.finGal :=
  AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_id _ _
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
lemma map_comp {L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ L‚ÇÉ : (FiniteGaloisIntermediateField k K)·µí·µñ}
    (f : L‚ÇÅ ‚ü∂ L‚ÇÇ) (g : L‚ÇÇ ‚ü∂ L‚ÇÉ) : finGalMap (f ‚â´ g) = finGalMap f ‚â´ finGalMap g := by
```
You can use `IsScalarTower.of_algebraMap_eq' rfl` instead.
I think this should be stated the other way round.
swap the two side of iff?
Yes
Could you please use this wording also in the module docstring?
Since they are in the `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` namespace, I think it is fine to drop the `fin` prefix. Otherwise the names get so long, but it's up to you.

```suggestion
structure FiniteGaloisIntermediateField extends IntermediateField k K where
  [finiteDimensional : FiniteDimensional k toIntermediateField]
  [isGalois : IsGalois k toIntermediateField]
```
We should avoid `nolint simpNF`. Either remove `@[simp]` from `le_iff` or state these with `.toIntermediateField` (or rather coerced).
What do you mean by remove `@[simp]`? remove these two `@[simp]` or what?

Remove the `@[simp]` line from the `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField.le_iff` lemma that you added above. This is why the `simpNF` linter complains: the left hand sides of these two lemmas are not in `simp` normal form, i.e. there is a `simp` lemma somewhere (in this case `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField.le_iff`) that applies to the left hand side of your lemmas and changes it to something syntactically different. This means that these lemmas will probably never trigger in a `simp` call as the LHS will be simplified to something else first.
Thank you, I would prefer to resolve this way.
But the second one still have normal form problem (I think it is because it used the first one), how to resolve? What about changing the priority? Thank you.

Ah, probably the second one is solvable by `simp` already, so in this case either remove `@[simp]` from `adjoin_simple_le_iff` or remove `adjoin_simple_le_iff` altogether. I think `adjoin_simple_le_iff` is not needed.

I think the best way is to
- keep `le_iff` a `simp` lemma
- remove `@[simp]` from `adjoin_le_iff` (as it is now provable by `simp`)
- remove `adjoin_simple_le_iff`
Actually I prefer to leave `adjoin_simple_le_iff` as it would be used more in this file latter, is it OK?
This proof should probably be in tactic mode rather than in term mode

Although it is in #16993, do you mean like this?

instance instSMulMemClass : SMulMemClass (IntermediateField k K) k K where
  smul_mem := by
    intro _ _ _ hx
    exact IntermediateField.smul_mem _ hx
I would be interested to hear @faenuccio's reasoning here.

No, I am sorry, I was not speaking about the `instance instSMulMemClass` (whose term-mode proof is perfectly fine), I was speaking about `lemma normalClosure_map` whose proof is long-ish, morally written in tactic mode, but presented in term mode.
Oh I think it's me who suggested it and I still prefer it in term mode. (The only difference in tactic mode would be a `by` and an `exact`), but of course this is only aesthetics.

No, not only: it only permits to "navigate" the proof if someone is reading the code. So the "by" and the "exact" in my opinion do a good job. I prefer term mode if the term is self-explanatory, but if one needs to "understand" it, I very much prefer tactic mode. I agree it is the author's choice, at the end, though.
I'd call this `normalClosure_map_eq`, no?
Is this instance needed? At least in this file, it can be commented out.
Moved to the needed place in #16993.
When calling a non-terminal `dsimp`, try to use `dsimp?` to get the `dsimp only` version.
Why `MonoidHom`? Can't you upgrade it to an `AlgebraHom`?

I think you didn't get it correctly, the left side is the `MonoidHom` given by the restriction of the Galois group to a normal subextension (actually itself for here), the right side is the identity `MonoidHom` to the smaller Galois group itself.
Oh, I see. I am sorry, please forget this comment.
Can you add a bit of doc to both this and the following two lemmas?
Added, could you please check if the description is appropriate, thank you.
Are you sure you `pushed`? I do not find it.

This commit below is about this, I am pretty sure I have pushed.
![ÂõæÁâá](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/759e518a-ef72-484c-ae92-43f236b561ce)
Found! Thanks.

It seems to me that the topology is not called "Krull topology" in Mathlib, am I wrong? If this is the case, this lemma shuold not refer to it. 

BTW Why don't you state it for subgroups rather than subsets? And do you have a corresponding statement for closed ones, removing the finiteness assumption/conclusion?

I think in Mathlib it is called Krulltopology rather than induced from the open compact topology, I think it is the only topology we have on Galois group for now. 
And can you explain a bit more about the second problem? I didn't get it clearly.

Oh, I see! The problem is that the file `KrullTopology` is not in the Galois subfolder, this seems odd. After this PR will be closed, can you please open a discussion on Zulip to see if we should not move it there?

Concerning the second point, I was wondering if rather than assuming that `s` is a set belonging to the neighbourhoods of `1` you cannot use the `OpenSubgroup` structure; for the "closed" point, what I was asking is if you can prove (or if you can point to me at where this is in the library) that every subgroup fixing a field is closed (here you prove that every subgroup fixing a finite extension is open, so in particularly closed).

Including fixing subgroup is closed, fixing subgroup normal iff Galois and fixing subgroup open iff finite dimensional are all proved in #16982, this lemma exist is initially because it is very frequently used in this PR and #16982.
OK, I see, no problem. On the other hand, why do you prefer that `S` be a set rather than a term of `OpenSubgroup`?
Because when proving, a set is  taken as complement of a subgroup that is trying to be prove closed, using continuousMul to move it to the neighborhood of `1` then pick a `OpenSubgroup` inside.
OK, I am fine with this. Just a small final thing: can you rename `S` to something that is more classically used for fields (like `F` or `E`)?

```suggestion
/-- The group homomorphism given by restricting an algebra isomorphisms to a normal subfield
```

```suggestion
/-- The group homomorphism given by restricting an algebra isomorphisms to itself
```
Is this `ext` attribute useful? Both fields are `Prop`s, so I think it is useless. I tried it on an example and I do not think it has any effect. Have you good reasons for adding it?
No significant reason, removed

```suggestion
/-- The type of intermediate fields of `K/k` that are finite and Galois over `k`-/
```

```suggestion
/--Turns the collection of finite Galois IntermediateFields of `K/k` into a lattice. -/
```

```suggestion
    IsGalois k ‚Üë(L‚ÇÅ ‚äî L‚ÇÇ) where
```
this avoids entering tactic mode "for nothing"

```suggestion
instance (L‚ÇÅ L‚ÇÇ : IntermediateField k K) [IsGalois k L‚ÇÅ] [IsGalois k L‚ÇÇ] :
    IsGalois k ‚Üë(L‚ÇÅ ‚äì L‚ÇÇ) where
```
I am not sure to understand this doc. From what is it obtained?
Stated in another way.
Thanks!
Why do you want to make `k` explicit here?
When using in other places I don't think `k` can be infered when only given the set `s` of `K`

```suggestion
theorem adjoin_algebraMap [IsGalois k K] (f : K ‚Üí‚Çê[k] K) (s : Set K) [Finite s] :
```
And also in all other names.
I think in current `mathlib` the theorem for `IntermediateField` is named `IntermediateField.adjoin_map`, should I still change?
No, good point! It is better to align with mathlib, so I take back my proposal, thanks for letting me know.

```suggestion
  the restriction homomorphism from `Gal(L‚ÇÅ/k)` to `Gal(L‚ÇÇ/k)`-/
```
Can you also add the corresponding Galois insertion?
I think this should be added to  PR #16982 The Fundamental theorem of Infinite Galois Theory, or only adding the finite case here?
No, I would add the finite case here as well. It can be useful if one is in the finite setting (and probably some classes change a bit).
Actually, I don't clearly know what is the finite case you want, I have no idea, I am actually waiting for your suggestion.
In insertion and coinsertion, the trivial result can't get the `le_l_u` and `u_l_le`, they all need results from PR #16982

```suggestion
/-- The functor mapping `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` ordered by reverse inclusion to its
  corresponding Galois Group as `FiniteGrp`. -/
```
Can you prove it is an equivalence of categories?
Sorry, what do you want me to prove? equivilence of `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` with what?
Do you mean the equivilence between `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` and the quotient group of open normal subgroup of `Gal(K/k)`? This definitely need the results from PR #16982

OK, good point. On the other hand, I would change a bit the doc, writing
```quote
/-- The functor from `FiniteGaloisIntermediateField` (ordered by reverse inclusion) to `FiniteGrp`,
mapping each field `K \subseteq L \subseteq k` to the Galois group of K/L`.-/
```

```suggestion
Galois extension `K/k` defined as the the normal closure of the field obtained by adjoining the set `s : Set K` to `k`. -/
```

```suggestion
  finite `s : Set K` to `k`.
```

I guess here you want `Gal(L/k)`, no? It could also be the subgroup `Gal (K/L)`but I suppose the first. In particular, the last doc changed I asked you (about the functor) should be changed by using the quotient instead of the subgroup.
I think that both here and in the doc at the beginning of the file, the Galois group should be `Gal(L/k)`.

This map exists only as (categorical-theoretical) morphism but not as hones ring map. Can you add this, and possibly use it to build this morphism? Also, can you please move all results expressed in categorial terms to a separate section `Category` (or something like this)?

The results expressed in categorial terms are moved to a new section currently called `profinite`.
However, what do you mean by "hones ring map"? I think I know nothing about it.
I am sorry, I meant as _honest_ ring map, as in [RingHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Hom/Defs.html#RingHom)
I think the map itself is alredy there, I just used `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom` and express it categorycally. So do you mean by giving the map when the two extensions have a `RingHom`?

Yes, you're right. I have tried and it is simply that. All in all, I think that now this PR is ready to go. Thank you very much for your patience, I hope you did not take my comments as being too pushy, but sometimes the early life of mathlib contributors is a bit hard, I remember it very well... But your contributions are really valuable.
Do you see a reason why all the variables are implicit in `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom`? Maybe you can change them in this PR if this does not cause too much troubles.

I think not all, the intermediate field being restict to is explicit, and for all the places used in this PR (even whole mathlib), only one of the three  things like (F := F) (K1 := K) in `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom_comp` is need to be written explicitly because it involve to much `AlgEquiv.restrictNormalHom`. 
So if the current setting of variable is OK in this case then I prefer to leave it there for this PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/Galois): Finite galois subextensions

source.title: feat(FieldTheory/Galois): Fundamental theorem of infinite galois theory

nodes.body: This PR seems to be mixing a move of `Galois` to `Galois.Basic` with the addition of finite Galois subextensions. Could you please make the moving a separate PR?

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#17197~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
I'll review more later, I have to run now.
I left some comments before touching upon the main file `InfiniteDimensional.lean` (which should probably have another name, there is no "dimension" involved, no?).

There is indeed no dimension directly involved in the file `InfiniteDimensional.lean`, it is only because this part is usually called infinite Galois theory, any suggestions about the naming of the file `FieldTheory.Galois.InfiniteDimensional` ? Thank you.

> There is indeed no dimension directly involved in the file `InfiniteDimensional.lean`, it is only because this part is usually called infinite Galois theory, any suggestions about the naming of the file `FieldTheory.Galois.InfiniteDimensional` ? Thank you.

What about just `Infinite`? Being already in `FieldTheory.Galois`, it will be unambiguous.
I left some comments about the `Infinite` file

I have added a couple of comments, but I now realise where most of my confusion (that also caused the misunderstanding about the Galois insertion) comes from the question: why do you want to phrase these results in categorical terms? All results in `Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Basic` are expressed just using groups/group homomorphisms and never using category theory. Can you provide a good explanation for this change?

The category part exist because I need to use the limit of profinite group to prove the Galois group is equal to the projective limit of the Galois Group of finite Galois subextensions thus profinite in PR #16993. The fundamental theorem doesn't use them.
I think we're almost done. Please merge master and address my three remarks.
maintainer merge
